author: curtdfw
title: PIO to OCI - SF Consulate
text: # 1 Got my PIO in 2008 via my now-US citizen spouse. Applying for OCI via Cox & Kings, got the following OCI - Incomplete Document email: Your application received by CKGS VAC is Not Complete and the processing is On Hold due to Incomplete / Incorrect Documentation. Please complete your application by sending the required documents within 7 working days the documents as stated below to our CKGS Application Centre. On receiving the correct document (s) and only post verification of the documents received by us, your Application will be Submitted to the Indian Embassy / Consulate for further processing. 1)PHYSICAL PIO CARD; 2)APPLYING THROUGH SPOUSE WILL BE REFERRED TO MINISTRY AND PROCESS WILL TAKE A VERY LONG TIME OR NO GUARANTEE. APPLICANT IS ADVISED TO APPLY FOR VISA INSTEAD. WITHDRAWAL REQUEST FORM IS REQUIRED. IF APPLICANT INSISTS TO CONTINUE WITH THE PROCESS, SIGNED STATEMENT MUST BE PROVIDED, MENTIONING THAT APPLICANT AGREES TO THE CONDITION OF THE LONG PROCESS AND HE WAS INFORMED THAT THERE IS NO GUARANTEE THAT SERVICE WILL BE PROVIDED. Anyone seen a reply like this? The application didn't mention sending original PIO, and given 2) I'm highly reluctant to let it out of my hands... As I just renewed my US passport I'm thinking I'll just get my existing PIO amended with the new passport number and lifetime stamp. She was not quite what you would call refined. She was not quite what you would call unrefined. She was the kind of person that keeps a parrot.  Mark Twain Last edited by curtdfw; Yesterday at 20:14 .. Reason: more data, formatting
